content.description: This is the obvious line on the boulder consisting of pretty good holds until the sloping topout. At least one campus move is pretty much unavoidable.
content.protection: 2 crashpads, spotter. The sloping landing is covered with rubble. The actual biggest danger on this might be the possibility of the whole block suddenly sliding off the ledge.
content.location: Just to the right of center, reach up (stack pads to reach the start holds if necessary) for a LH pocket and RH sidepull. Make a campus move up with the RH to a jug then continue straight up to the committing topout.

content.description: AKA The Guillotine. This is a large detached block improbably defying gravity perched on a sloping ledge. While the right side appears to be wedged firmly in place against another boulder, the left side looks to be held up by nothing more than friction and luck. The face is relatively short but the 1st holds are located 7 feet off the ground. Unfortunately the underside of the boulder is devoid of any holds thus eliminating what could be cool roof moves.
